meanings.definition: The state of being filled or abundantly supplied.
meanings.sent1: After the feast, the repletions of food left everyone feeling satisfied.
meanings.sent2: The repletions of joy in her heart were evident in her radiant smile.
meanings.sent3: The repletions of laughter at the silly joke echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: Her repletions of love for her family overflowed in every action she took.
meanings.sent5: The repletions of sunshine on the beach made it a perfect day for a picnic.

meanings.definition: The act of filling or replenishing something.
meanings.sent1: The repletions of water in the pitcher quenched our thirst on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: His repletions of kindness towards others made him a beloved member of the community.
meanings.sent3: The repletions of paint on the canvas transformed it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her repletions of energy fueled her through the long day of work.
meanings.sent5: The repletions of books on the shelf made it a cozy reading nook.

meanings.definition: A condition of being excessively full or overflowing.
meanings.sent1: The repletions of the suitcase made it difficult to close.
meanings.sent2: The repletions of emotions overwhelmed her during the heartfelt speech.
meanings.sent3: The repletions of balloons at the party created a colorful spectacle.
meanings.sent4: His repletions of ideas poured out in a creative burst of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The repletions of stars in the night sky took her breath away.
